title: 2009 Crime Incident ata Request (Rosemont Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 2009 Crime Incident ata Request (Rosemont Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Kristina Block, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Village of Rosemont Public Records Center.  If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you. 
 
Once your email address has been verified, you can log into the Public Records Center to update any contact or password information.  You will so be able to monitor and track the progress the of your request and receive most responsive documents. 
 Your Login ID is:  181204-63237441@requests.muckrock.com 
 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaITRleVXCdgKPbmsix2zPu4uxuV7gzfP80uNdEj-2B-2FiQWwwDrTwgS4v6J06k-2BPkd5-2Bb9asrXX-2Ffio19SIrjl9uA-3D0d5Z_BE1GqxYnhNbEP4Z1YUJuocfXaPx0exs-2FZunekc4VMtWA7hLRGCQEJ5GSJ2U-2F04scdxsQFtzbVOR3qsdmAc2gfhAI7uIixR8dCy5sKo4vo-2B9fPUeMgHn3KE543Hf1z7fLPVCH8m-2B9yWexH-2B0QDzGgPLHhV5LX3vFVja2DucoZlGQA5dQ10TuujR6Z4uKO2NIC3h5b8as-2ByCZpKoU0Cy-2FlRNio67YtJmTbnKL668aAFjc-3D) 
 
Please login to the "My Records Center"  to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaITRleVXCdgKPbmsix2zPtdzs4WDt5TNqmweDe8KYoGmCcED3PnYyURuTecN7e7xIagIdRhQVnLxiTEd6QXVms-3D8_bp_BE1GqxYnhNbEP4Z1YUJuocfXaPx0exs-2FZunekc4VMtWA7hLRGCQEJ5GSJ2U-2F04scdxsQFtzbVOR3qsdmAc2gfhMbMh-2Fyadrgd4nvzaoGm-2FkxewW8CB24n-2F3OmgPsJp0oUSHnhJS4YfZKSvsBLvnN3X-2BWVDYTsqHMXBN35q7ymK9sYK-2FV5WNb62PTNQwTO97i-2BoZW4NzDP3SgPwgoRPA5or1GQeX9hx5AKgGeSdmWGEM-3D) 
 
Now that you are registered, please use My Records Center for all new requests in the future as well. You may track all requests in the same spot. 
 Save this email for future reference. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

title: 2009 Crime Incident ata Request (Boston Police Department)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: 2009 Crime Incident ata Request (Boston Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Kristina Block, 
Thank you for registering with the Records Center.  Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Login: 181201-22986839@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXTIDeIcW7QPGcxbg2r6mBl4v5YArf88j-2FuVDN6ocqvIVap6zHF-2FD-2BpMyPdeKYbfEVA46iZ01n6SYPHtOddU8KHA-3Dxrs2_gobWQsSOTq2OR3ACLK5qksOBrp6YXDwZd-2BGfp-2Fm60vvzMMuBNYf5LTpF3CytvCxhlFULakAqSBwL46Upd45J88YXnuTzhRQGsbSu2g1UpMB1K9eK3t7-2F5xdIlO7FoDd9b55-2FE-2Bfu-2BNaMao0DbVl17e3W7Gp9stdgVVikNOtLe9Pa9x2EB-2FKWrvUDHecQoHsU0KX5kW5WnHphkTrn9JDv7wJ5JD96FFDvrEJagZbxhpE-3D) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B000419-021025
communications.communication:
Dear Kristina Block 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Boston Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 2/10/2025 9:49:50 PM and given the reference number B000419-021025 for tracking purposes. 
If this is a media request, please contact the Office of Media Relations directly at 617.343.4520. 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block
